content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Implement AS MANY new ideas as you can as PopeBot skills in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). For EACH skill: create the SKILL.md, write the implementation code, and write and run a test to prove it works. Do not stop at one skill â€” keep going until you run out of good ideas or time. After you have built and tested everything, use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a comprehensive progress report listing every skill you built, your test results for each, and code samples.

content.thinking:
This is a comprehensive task. I need to:

1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Implement as many new ideas as possible as PopeBot skills in the .pi/skills/ directory
3. For each skill: create SKILL.md, write implementation code, write and run tests
4. Email a comprehensive progress report to winsorllc@yahoo.com

Let me start by exploring the repositories to gather ideas. I'll use the http-request skill to fetch information from these GitHub repos.

Let me start by reading what's already in the pi-skills directory and the existing skills to understand the current state, then scan the external repos for ideas.

First, let me explore the current structure and then scan the GitHub repositories.

content.text: I'll scan the three GitHub repositories for new ideas and implement them as PopeBot skills. Let me start by exploring the repositories and the current skill structure.
